peeragogical-action-review.title: Peeragogical Action Reviews Repository Progress PAR 2020-06-16
peeragogical-action-review.intention-review: We want to collect our previous Peeragogical Action Reviews (PARs) into one place for easy reference and further work. In particular, these PARs can serve as “proto-patterns”: they represent little semi-formal learnings that may have transferable information in them. Before we can extract patterns, we need data, and that’s what this repository achieves.
peeragogical-action-review.what-happened: We’re sharing and developing a “good practice” for everyone in the project.

html:ul.html:li: Practice: Getting in the habit of writing PARs collectively during meetings and other interactions would be a good idea
Effort: Let’s contribute to finding a list of the previous PARs
Technical: The repository contains XML formatted documents, we need to learn how to produce those and use them in downstream formats
Mathematics: The PARs are a little bit like “tangent vectors”, maybe we can use them to understand the way the project is changing and evolving

peeragogical-action-review.learnings-changes: This is a key resource of the project that has been “hidden” in the past (consider the iceberg metaphor).
peeragogical-action-review.what-else-should-change-going-forward: Let’s get in the habit of writing PARs here, and make them a bigger part of the book!
